conversations.content:
I'll be arriving in London on March 15th. Last year, I stayed at the 'London Luxury Hotel', which had amazing reviews and ratings. It was super quiet and clean, and my room had a view of the Thames River. It was such a great experience! This time, I want to try out a new hotel. Once I figure out which one is the best, I'll head there and then find a good restaurant to eat at with my friends.
I have a budget of 160 for the hotel, and I want to stay in a hotel with the highest rating. Can you recommend a hotel? Tell me the name, rating, price range, and address. Thanks a bunch!

<function_thought>
To fulfill the user's request for a hotel recommendation in London for March 15th, I will start by fetching all hotels available in London and then filter the results according to their ratings and price range. 
The user's budget for the hotel is 160, and they are specifically looking for a hotel with the highest rating within that budget. 
I will execute the first function to retrieve the list of hotels in London.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_all_hotels_in_city(city="London")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

Hotel Names: Cozy Stay
Mom's Home
London Luxury
Covent Garden Retreat
Riverside View

<function_thought>
I have retrieved a list of hotels in London, which includes:
1. Cozy Stay
2. Mom's Home
3. London Luxury
4. Covent Garden Retreat
5. Riverside View

Next, I will check the price range of these hotels to find out which ones are within the user's budget of 160. After that, I will obtain ratings and reviews for the filtered hotels.
</function_thought>

</function_thought>
